answers.answer: If you have type 2 diabetes, you should have a family MD who follows you or a clinic. Let them tell you what they think all of these long term symptoms might be.
I will check that out, my family doctor is useless i tell him about the pains and he says all your blood tests were normal. I ask him to send me for a ct scan and he says its not necessary.

Go find another doctor who cares about your health and well being. Doctors are humans, some just get burnt out and need to retire. It is possible that diabetes has caused nerve damage, a Neurologist can run simple tests. Try posting on the Neurology and Rheumatoid Arthritis Ask a Doctor forums too.

question: i have very bad pain in my sides my back my stomach and sometimes my shoulders hurt the pain in my left side feels like something heavy is there like a groth or something. i have type 2 diabetes and my spine hurts also, Every day i suffer some kind of pain in my body and i am very worried about it.
title: pains in my body every day for over a year
